Zenaida still has her business buying and selling crafts. She buys clay ornaments and another group does the finishing work. She buys wholesale, and sells them at retail or individually. 

The borrower expanded her shop to display her crafts, and now wishes to buy merchandise to sell. She is applying for the loan, in order to buy merchandise such as earrings, jewelry, clay figurines, paints, enamels, and brushes for making handicrafts.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of merchandise such as earrings, jewelry, clay ornaments, paints, enamels, and brushes for making handicrafts.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 36-year-old Fatu from Goderich western area in Freetown. She is married with four children between the ages of ten and twenty-one. Fatu's children attend school. 

She runs an entertainment center at her Goderich, she sells food, drinks, alcohol, sardines, cigarettes and milk at her store. She has been running this business for eight years. She works at the business seven days per week. Her main source of income comes from her business.  Fatu says that the main challenge to her business is that her capital to invest is not sufficient.

Fatu has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items, drinks, alcohol, sardines and milk. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve their standard of living and take better care for her children's schooling.  In the future, she plans to expand her business more.  She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more cooking items, drinks, alcohol, sardines and milk.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alicia, La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende diferentes tipos de productos como leche, golosinas, arroz, azucar entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual mediante este la socia saca adelante a su familia, la socia vende todos los días desde las 07:00am hasta las 10:00pm aproximadamente, la socia es una persona  responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes.

La socia  se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Alicia belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres en Accion."  This bank is located in the Anta district, which is in Anta province in the department of Cusco.

Alicia alternates her daily activities with her work in her grocery store business.  She sells a variety of products such as milk, candy, rice, sugar and other items.  She has had this business for years, and through the business she provides for her family.  She sells every day from 7am until about 10pm.  Alicia is a responsible person who has a strong desire to get ahead with her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise for her grocery store.

Alicia is committed to making all of the payments on her loan.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 34 years old and lives in Sinkor.  She is married and her husband is a driver, they have four children aged between one month and nineteen years old.  All of them are in school and all of them live at home.  

For the past ten years Josephine has been selling palm oil ,she says her main challenge is that, during the rainy season, the price of palm oil goes up steeply.  

She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and she learned this from her sister.  What she likes about this business is that it is profit-making.   Josephine is requesting a loan to purchase more goods such as palm oil for her business.  She plans to educate her children and build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of fish to fry and sell

loans.name: Carla Denise

texts.es:
Doña Carla, casada,  de oficio Docente, actualmente esta trabajando como asalariada como educadora en un cetro que apoya a las mujeres que sufren maltrato.

Su nucleo familiar la componen tres personas, se presenta nuestra oficina para solicitar un nuevo prestamos para mejorar su vivienda, comenta que quiere ampliar unos de sus cuarto por lo que necesita comprar materiales de construcción. 

Considera que esta prestamos,  le ayudara a tener una mejor calidad de vida y comodidad para su hijo
texts.en:
Carla is married and is a Teacher currently working as a salaried teacher at a center that supports women who have been abused.
Her nuclear family consists of three people.  She came by our office to request a new home improvement loan.  She comments that she wants to enlarge one of her rooms and needs to buy building materials and supplies.  She believes that with this loan she’ll have a better quality of life and comfort for her son.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Mery Carlota

texts.es: La socia Mery; continua con su negocio de la imprenta, la socia continua elaborando almanaques, tarjetas para todo tipo de compromisos como bautizos, matrimonios, fiestas de 15 años entre otros. La socia requiere en esta ocasión invertir el prestamo en la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de las diferentes tarjetas con las impresiones y logos respectivos, ella tambien desea invertir en la compra de tinata para las maquinas.
texts.en: Mery continues with her print shop.  She continues to make calendars and greeting cards for all types of social engagements like Baptisms, weddings, 15-year-old birthday parties, etc.  On this occasion she needs the loan to buy supplies to make the various cards with their respective images and logos; she also wants to buy ink for the machines.

loans.use: to buy printing supplies.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 35 years old and is married with three children. He owns a retail shop. He has been in this business for 2 years. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to expand his retail shop. He describes his business environment as competitive due to the high number of retail businesses in that region. He has applied for a loan of 60,000 KES to buy sugar, maize flour, cooking oil, and rice.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour, cooking oil, and rice.

loans.name: Lorwo

texts.en: Lorwo is 25 years old and lives in Sinkor. She is single and has three children between 7 and 10 years old. All of the children are in school and live at home. For the past six  years, she has been selling building materials (nails, white wash, & cement). She says her main challenge is that sometime business is slow. She started this business with her own money and she learned this from her friend. What she likes about this business is the buying, Lorwo is requesting a loan to purchase building materials (nails, white wash, & cement) for her business. She plans to educate her children so that they will be able to look after her in the future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials (nails, white wash, & cement) for her business

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is a fish monger. She smokes fish to sell in Adum Banso near Takoradi. She has been in this business for 30 years now.  Adjoa is divorced and has three children. As a single parent, Adjoa uses her income to feed, clothe and pay her children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase more fish, which she will smoke for sale. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish

loans.name: Krumba

texts.en: Krumba lives in Sinkor. She is 37 years old. She has five children between 10 and 20 years old. The children are in school and live at home. For the past three years, she has been selling palm oil. Krumba says she is proud of her business because of her daily savings. It was her oldest brother who helped her to start this business with a little amount of money. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. In the future, she wants to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil

loans.name: Leocadia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de leche,ella lleva a las diferentes ferias del distrito de Cusco,la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la leche.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar leche al por mayor.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The partner continues with her business selling milk at the various street markets in Cusco District.  Through this business she’s able to raise her children.  Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell the milk.  She requests the loan to buy milk at wholesale.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy milk at wholesle.

loans.name: Tricia Jesus

texts.es: La socia Tricia; continua con su negocio de la fotocopiadora, la socia tiene un lugar privilegiado en cuanto a la ubicacion de sus negocio motivo por el cual ella esta muy feliz y ahora que comenzaron las clases ella desea comprar tintas para las impresiones, desea hacerle el mantenimiento respectivo y continuar creciendo y poder ahorrar para ampliar su negocio y tambien sus maquinas.
texts.en: Tricia continues with her photocopying services.  Her business is located in a favorable location which makes her very happy and now that classes have begun she wants to buy ink for her printers and service them to continue growing to be able to save to expand the business as well as her machines.

loans.use: to buy ink for the printers and to service the machines.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia,el tiene ganados los hace engordar y crecer y luego los lleva a vender a las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta,el socio trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de ganaderia. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para los ganados.
 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The partner continues raising livestock.  He has cattle that he raises and fattens up and then takes to sell at various street markets that exist in Anta District.  He works from 5am until 6pm and is able to support his children with this business.  His dream is to expand the cattle raising business.  He’s asking for a loan to buy feed for the cattle.  He’s happy with the loan and commits to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es: El socio Adrian; Continua con su negocio de compra y venta de artesanía como muñecas de tela,llamas,vicuñas entre otros, el socio desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de materiale spara la elaboracion de sus diferentes trabajos en artesania, el socio comprara mantas tipicas hechas, tambien lanas de alpaca, vicuña, oveja, el socio tambien comprara, pinceles, fibra para el relleno d elos muñecos, tela simple para el cuerpo de los mismos entre otros materiales.
texts.en: Adrián continues buying and selling crafts like cloth dolls, llamas and vicuñas, among others.  He wants to use the loan to buy supplies to make his various crafts.  He will buy traditional made blankets as well as alpaca, vicuña and sheep’s wool.  He will also buy paint brushes and fiber stuffing for the dolls as well as fabric for the dolls’ bodies among other supplies.

loans.use: to buy traditional blankets, alpaca, vicuña and sheep's wool as well as brushes, stuffing for dolls and fabric, among other supplies.

loans.name: Sop Borom Darou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité sop borom darou a été créé le 10/12/10. Il est composé de 17 femmes issues de la même localité. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce. 

Adji debout à droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée sans enfant. 

Avec son prêt reçu, elle va acheter de bijoux, habits d'enfants et femmes, des chaussures. En sus, elle développe une activité de vente d'arachides. 

Ses bénéfices lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Borom Darou was created 10/12/2010. It consists of 17 women from the same neighborhood whose main activity is small trade. 

Adji is the head of the group. She is the one standing at the far right in the photo. She is 38 years old and married without children. 

She intends to use her loan to buy jewelry, children’s and ladies’ clothing, and shoes. She also sells groundnuts as a secondary activity.  

Her profits will allow her to help her husband provide for the family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy jewelry, clothing and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is a fishmonger in Adum Banso near Takoradi. She sells smoked fish. She has been in this business for 11 years now.  Efua is married to a farmer and has six dependants.  Efua assists her husband to feed and clothe their children. Efua will use her loan to purchase more fish, which she will smoke and sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: La socia Luisa; continua con su negocio de compra y venta de artesanía especialmente de telares como mantas, la socia compra la mercaderia que consiste en la compra de lanas al por mayor de alpaca, oveja, vicuña entre otras y comprar por madejones y de colores, la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de lanas de colores para la realizacion de las mantas con diseños.
texts.en: Luisa continues buying and selling crafts especially textiles like blankets.  She buys the merchandise which consists in alpaca, sheep and vicuña wool at wholesale, among others, and she buys skeins of various colors.  She wants to use the loan to buy wool yarn in assorted colors to make blankets with designs.

loans.use: to buy wool yarn in assorted colors.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La socia anteriormente se dedicaba al negocio de venta de leche pero no le fue muy bien,ahora se esta dedicando al negocio de ganaderia y tambien a la agricultura,ella siembra papa,cebada,maiz y trigo y luego lo vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de ganaderia y agricultura.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas para su terreno de agricultura y tambien para comprar alimentos para los ganados.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member used to have a business selling milk but didn’t do too well.  Now, she’s in the business of raising livestock and farming.  She farms potatoes, barley, corn and wheat that she then sells at the various street markets in Anta District.  She’s able to support her children through these businesses.  Her dream is to expand the cattle raising and the farming.  She’s requesting the loan to buy seeds for her fields and also to buy feed for the cattle.  She’s happy with the loan and committed to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and seeds.

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina is a 36-year-old, married woman with three children. Melodina lives in Villa M. Tejero, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

To earn a living, Melodina owns and operates a general store. She explains that she has had this business for six years and that she earns 5,000 PHP per month doing this type of work.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP to purchase more goods and inventory for her general store. Melodina has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Melodina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods and inventory for her general store

location.town: Liloy-Villa M Tejero, Liloy Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Jonaphel

texts.en:
Jonaphel is a 32-year-old, married woman living in Baybay, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She and her husband have three children.

To earn a living, Jonaphel works in the fish industry. Specifically, she sells dried fish, which she has been doing for two years.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to purchase more fish for resale purposes. Jonaphel has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Jonaphel hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to re-sell

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura is a 56-year-old, married woman living in Silucap, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She and her husband have five children.

To earn a living, Maura works in the fish industry. Specifically, she sells fish, which she has been doing for ten years.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 3,000 PHP to purchase more fish for resale purposes. Maura has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Maura hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to re-sell

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina is a 37-year-old, married woman living in Poblacion 1, Clarin. Edwina and her husband have four children.

To earn a living, Edwina has a snack business. She explains that she typically earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month doing this type of work.

Edwina has requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional ingredients, such as sugar, oil, and flour, for her business. Edwina has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Edwina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional ingredients such as sugar, oil, and flour

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 45 years old.  She is married and has six children.

Elena owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro to sell.  She has two years of experience in this business.  Elena is requesting a loan of 1,500 WST to purchase land to raise additional crops.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 512 WST or $213 per week) to improve her family’s general living conditions.

In 2010, Elena joined SPBD in order to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Elena's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase land to raise additional crops.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a 42-year-old, married woman living at Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. She and her husband have eight children.

To earn a living, Alma owns and operates a general store, where she sells a variety of different products. She explains that she has been running this business for three years. Each month, she earns approximately 5,000 PHP from her business.

She requested a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to purchase more products for resale purposes. Alma became a member of GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Alma hopes to help her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to re-sell

loans.name: Edelita

texts.en:
Edelita is a 35-year-old, married woman living in Maikay, Tudela. Edelita and her husband have two children.

To earn a living, Edelita operates a store that sells a variety of products. Edelita explains that she has had this business for six years.

Edelita requested a loan in the amount of 14,900 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents. Edelita has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Edelita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents

loans.name: Nicole

texts.en: Nicole and Valerie opened Cornerstone Counseling & Consulting, Inc. eight years ago to provide clients with mental health specialized services. With a breadth of combined experience behind them – including construction and governmental work – Nicole and Valerie seek to offer their clients access to a range of services, such as: Mental Health Counseling, Case Management Services, Consultative Services, Sex Offender Groups, Counseling & Assessments, Parenting Groups, Non-Offending Sexual Abuse Parenting, Sexual Abuse Victim Empowerment (S.A.V.E.), Sexual Abuse Family Education (S.A.F.E.), Substance Abuse Groups, and Cognitive-Behavioral Groups. The business has been adding services throughout the years and in the future, they would like to include classes and group therapy sessions to develop the social skills of the clients they serve.  In order to grow their in care counseling services, Nicole and Valerie are seeking capital. A loan of $10,000 will allow them to purchase classroom computers and printers.

loans.use: to purchase classroom computers and printers.

loans.name: Tony

texts.en: Originally from Africa, Tony was raised in Fort Lauderdale, Florida. Tony was encouraged heavily by his family to open his own business and in 2011 decided to launch Topflight Taxes Inc. His home-based business provides bookkeeping and offers general consulting services for small businesses for all the Lauderhill/Ft. Lauderdale area. Because Topflight Taxes Inc earns the highest revenues during tax season, Tony also works at Target fulltime during the off season, and part-time during tax season, to supplement his income. A loan will help Tony to purchase computers and desks and to update his A/C system to accommodate clients that visit his home-based office.

loans.use: To pay for computers and desks and update his a/c system

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is from Silanga, Tangub City.  She is 44 years old.  Carmelita is married and has five children.  To earn a living, Carmelita operates a fishing business.  Carmelita has been engaged in her business for 12 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.  

In 2008, Carmelita joined GDMPC in order to gain access to financial services to help improve both her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Bryol

texts.en: Bryol and his wife Kettelene moved to the U.S. from Haiti and have owned and operated B.O. Christian Multiservices Inc. since February 2011. Their business provides tax preparation and money order transactions for Miami, Florida residents. In addition to running his business, Bryol supplements his household income by working as a taxi driver during the off season of tax preparation. Bryol understands the great challenge of opening a business - he had to work days, nights and long hours as a cab driver to save sufficient capital to open his business. Despite the long hours, “the effort was rewarding”. Now Bryol runs his own business, provides a job for his wife, has increased his family’s household income and still drives his cab in the Miami area. He states that his greatest success was to be able to provide a sustainable living to those that he loves, his family. To prepare for a busy tax season, Bryol is seeking a loan to pay for advertising costs that will help drive growth and acquire new customers.

loans.use: to pay for advertising costs

loans.name: Lulu

texts.en:
Lulu is a 57-year-old, married woman with one child.

To earn a living, Lulu owns and operates a business venture. Specifically, she sells bamboo arts and crafts to tourists and local community members. She explains that she has two years of experience in this business.

Lulu is seeking a loan in the amount of 1,500 WST to purchase raw materials so that she can make additional arts and crafts to sell. She plans to use any additional profits from her business as a result of the loan (estimated to be 400 WST, or $167 per week) to improve and expand her business.

In 2010, Lulu joined SPBD to gain much-needed access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This would be Lulu's second loan through SPBD.

loans.use: to make additional bamboo arts and crafts by purchasing more raw materials

loans.name: Sop Mame Awa Balla Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Mame Awa Balla été crée le 10/12/2010. Il est composé de 15 femmes issues de la même localité. Elles exercent les mêmes activités (le commerce d'habits, de bijoux, de parfums et l'embouche)

Coumba debout à droite de la photo est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée sans enfant mais a la charge de 04 enfants dont un neveu et une nièce. 

Elle fait de l'embouche ovine. Elle a une bonne expérience de cette activité pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis plusieurs années

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle va mieux développer son activité afin d'augmenter son niveau d'épargne. 

Ses bénéfices lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Mame Awa Balla was created 10/12/2010. It consists of 15 women from the same neighborhood. The group sells clothing, jewelry and perfume, and they also practice cattle fattening. 

Coumba is the head of the group. She is the one standing at the far right in the photo. She is 41 years old and married without children, although she does have four children in her care, including a nephew and a niece. 

Coumba’s activity is sheep fattening. With several years of experience to her credit, she now has a good command of her activity. She intends to use her loan to better develop her business so as to increase her savings.   

Her profits will allow her to help her husband provide for the family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening.

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is a 56-year-old, married woman from Tabid, Misamis Occidental. Caridad and her husband have five children.

To earn a living, Caridad operates a fishing business. Caridad explains that she has been engaged in this business for ten years and that she typically earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2009, Caridad joined GDMPC to gain much-needed access to financial services. Caridad is now requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fishing equipment such as hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to further improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing equipment such as hooks and nets

loans.name: Litia

texts.en:
Litia is a 27-year-old, married woman with one child.

To earn a living, Litia owns and operates a business venture. Specifically, she sells baked goods in her local community. She explains that she has two years of experience in this business.

Litia is seeking a loan in the amount of 1,500 WST to purchase more raw ingredients that are needed to make her baked goods for her customers. She plans to use any additional profits generated from her business as a result of the loan (estimated to be 350 WST or $146 per week) to improve and expand her business.

In 2010, Litia joined SPBD to gain much-needed access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This would be Litia's second loan through SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients needed to make baked goods for her business's customers

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en: Marlon is the proud owner of White Lotus Home, an organic bedding company that makes mattresses, pillows and other bedding products, out of organic fiber.  The original business was established in 1981 and Marlon began working at the company in 2002, becoming the sole owner in 2006.  Marlon sells his products on the internet, for wholesale and in his store operated out of Highland Park, New Jersey.  Marlon works with over 70 distribution partners in over 20 states. In addition, he recently began selling his products in Canada. Customers rave on his website about the quality of product and amazing customer service. Marlon needs capital to purchase bedding materials, in order to keep up with the sales growth in 2011. A loan will help him to make this purchase, also enabling business growth and new customer acquisition.

loans.use: to pay for bedding materials

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
Socorro is from Gata Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental.  She is 59 years old.  Socorro is married and has two children. 

To earn a living, Socorro runs a general store, selling a variety of food and household products in the local community.  Socorro has been in business for three years and earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Socorro is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase new items to expand her product offering.  In 2008, Socorro joined GDMPC in order to gain access to financial services to help her improve both her business and her living situation.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Sesaria

texts.en:
Sesaria is 30 years old.  She is married and has one child.

Sesaria owns and operates a business venture, selling dairy products in the local community.  She has two years of experience in this business.  Sesaria is requesting a loan of 1,500 WST in order to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 WST or $167 per week) to pay her child's tuition fees.

In 2010, Sesaria joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Sesaria's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make the dairy products she sells.

loans.name: Armelyn

texts.en:
Armelyn is a 49-year-old, married woman living in the Philippines. She and her husband have two children.

To earn a living, Armelyn operates a service-based business. Specifically, she provides transportation services to local community members. She explains that she has been doing this for eight years and that she typically earns 6,000 PHP per month from this line of work.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 14,000 PHP to repair a vehicle used in her business. In 2004, Armelyn joined GDMPC to gain much-needed access to financial services and to thereby improve her business. In the future, Armelyn hopes to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en: Ruben moved to Miami from Peru in 1990 and since his arrival, has worked diligently to build his credit history.  Like many immigrant entrepreneurs, Ruben realized that without credit it would be difficult to secure business capital from a commercial bank. For three years, Ruben received credit counseling while working two jobs - as a full time cook at Pollo Tropical and part-time at a packaging company - all to save money for his business. In 2000, as a result of Ruben’s determination and hard work, he was able to start an exporting business that initially relied heavily on his connection in Peru, a large buyer of medical hearing devices. Recently, Ruben has been approached by buyers all over Latin America and he needs capital to respond to the growing demand.  By raising capital for Ruben’s loan, he will be able to purchase the inventory he needs to export medical hearing devices overseas.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of inventory to export medical devices overseas

loans.name: Tofaga

texts.en:
Tofaga is 35 years old, married, and has seven children. Tofaga sells baked goods in the local community. She has three years of experience in this business. Tofaga needs a loan of 1,500 WST to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 WST) to improve/expand her business.

In 2010, Tofaga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Tofaga's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines.  She has been in business for nine years.  Mary Jane requested a loan in the amount of 11,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase spare parts for tricycle maintenance.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for tricycle maintenance.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 17 years.  In addition, Rosita earns income from raising and fattening pigs.

Rosita is borrowing 35,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase materials for her fish cage.  She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.  She dreams to build and expand her business in order to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her fish cage.

loans.name: Filda

texts.en:
Filda is a hardworking entrepreneur who operates a general store in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for eight years.  In addition, Filda earns income from selling prepared food and candle making.

Filda is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more items to stock and sell in her general store.  She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save money in order to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to stock and sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase ingredients to prepare her dishes.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 32 years old.  She is married and has six children.

Elsie owns and operates a business venture, selling fried foods in the local community.  She has many years of experience in this business.  Elsie is requesting a loan of 1,500 WST in order to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 WST or $104 per week) to financially support members of her immediate family.

In 2011, Elsie joined SPBD in order to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Elsie's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe BADEYA sont essentiellement des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 33  ans,  2 enfants et vivant majoritairement dans des  familles monogames à OUAYERMA I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Le prêt antérieure a été remboursé sans aucune difficulté.
ASSAN  (assise) 3ème à droite sur la photo fait la vente de lait dans ce groupe de femmes BADEYA, sa renommée en la matière fait d’elle une vendeuse très sollicitée. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  10 bidons de 20 litres de lait. Elle les revend de façon ambulante et en famille au comptant et à crédit à sa clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle s’approvisionne dans les parcs avoisinants de la ville de Sikasso.
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The seven members of the group BADEYA are married women with an average age of 33 years, and 2 children each. They live for the most part in monogamous families in OUAYERMA I, a working-class neighborhood of the city of Sikasso. This is their second time seeking a loan from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet customer demand. The previous loan they obtained was repaid without any difficulty.

ASSAN is a group member that sells milk. She is the one sitting 3rd from the right in the photo. Her reputation in her sector of activity has made her a very popular seller. She intends to use her loan to buy ten 20-liter cans of milk for resale as an itinerant vendor and from her home, for cash or on credit, to a clientele consisting of both men and women. She buys her stock in the neighboring parks, in Sikasso.

She intends to turn an average monthly profit of 22,500FCFA, which she will use partly to repay the loan and interest, and partly to increase her savings. 

Her goal is to bolster her sales to better satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy fresh milk for resale.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a retail business, selling salt in the Philippines.  She has been in business for 22 years.  In addition, Gloria earns income from a restaurant.

Gloria has requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more salt to sell in the market.  In the future, Gloria would like to save money in order to expand her business and help her grandchildren attend school.

loans.use: to buy salt to sell in the market.

loans.name: Mama

texts.en: Mama lives at Adum Banso with her husband, a driver, and their four childern. Mama operates a breakfast joint. The breakfast she prepares are oats, milo, and coffee. She serves it with bread and fried eggs. She has done this for eight years now. Mama will use her loan to purchase more bread, eggs, oats, milo, and coffee for the preparation of her breakfast dishes. With the new profit, Mama plans to expand her breakfast joint.

loans.use: purchase more eggs, oats, milo, and coffee

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 33 years old and lives in Sinkor. She is married, and her husband is a contractor. They have seven children, from 6 to 22 years old. All of the children are in school and only three of them live at home.

For the past 10 years, Beatrice has been selling charcoal, both retail and wholesale, in her community. She says her main challenge is during the raining season the rain damages her goods. 

She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She learned the business from her mother. What she likes about this business is it has enabled her to send her children to school. 

Beatrice is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She plans to educate her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 38 years old. She is married and has four children. With all her children in school, Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, snack foods and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Leonila requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

She has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Leonila would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 38 years old. She is married and has four children.

Liezel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Liezel has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years. She also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Liezel aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tobacco-selling retail business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her stall.

Nenita has been in this business for 15 years. Nenita also earns income from farming vegetables.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money so she can expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 53 years old and married with eight children.

Rosa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like soft drinks, snack foods and other groceries.

Rosa has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Rosa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like soft drinks, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Tomás

texts.es: Tomás de 49 años vive con en el sur occidente de la ciudad, con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 10 a 25 años. En su casa tiene varias actividades generadoras de ingreso,  ofrece el servicio de alquiler de lavadoras, de video juegos y venta de minutos a celulares,  actividades en las que tiene aproximadamente 5 años de estar ejerciendo.  Sus principales clientes, son los vecinos del sector, a quienes les ofrece el servicio de alquiler de estas máquinas y las traslada a domicilio,  subidas en una carretilla.  Su mayor desafío es lograr el crecimiento de su negocio, como él lo sueña, pues no tiene el capital de trabajo suficiente para obtenerlo; esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a al Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  el cual invertirá en la renovación del servicio de video juegos, comprando unos mas modernos, porque en la época de vacaciones,  los jóvenes y niños son sus clientes mas fieles y esto hace que su inversión en esta temporada sea aun mas exitosa.
texts.en:
Tomás is 49, and lives in the southwest part the city with his partner, and their children, ages 10 to 25.  He has several income-generating activities in his home.  He rents washing machines, video games, and sells cell phone minutes. He has been doing these activities for approximately five years.

His main customers are people in the same neighborhood, to whom he rents these machines. He transports them to the the customer's home, loaded on a cart. 

His greatest challenge is achieving growth in his business, as he dreams of doing. This is because he doesn't have sufficient working capital. This is the reason why he is approaching the Foundation for his credikiva. 

This is his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which he will use to update his video game service by buying some more modern ones. In the vacation season, young people and children are his most faithful customers, and this makes his investment at this season even more successful.

loans.use: To buy new video games for updating his business.

loans.name: Sonie

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Sonie works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling vegetables and spices in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig-fattening. Sonie is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables and spices to sell in her stall.

Sonie has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and spices to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El Comité “Mujeres Luchadoras” tiene 16 integrantes todas amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Villa Elisa. Este comité es nuevo aun dentro del programa de la fundación paraguaya. Ahora pasaron al 2do ciclo y sus pagos tantos como ellas son muy puntuales   y hoy en día son mujeres muy trabajadoras, activas y responsables.
Olga es una mujer muy emprendedora y dice que hace unos años empezó con una péquela tienda de bebidas y que gracias a su esfuerzo y sacrificio ha podido crecer y de esa for4ma convertirse en toda una microempresaria. Su meta es seguir trabajando y crecer, para que de esa forma pueda seguir ayudando a sus familiares.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cervezas, vinos, gaseosas,  demás tipos de bebidas, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y tener en stock esos productos.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Luchadoras” (Tenacious Women) communal bank has 16 members, and they are all friends and neighbors in the city of Villa Elisa.  This bank is new to the program with the Fundación Paraguaya.  They are now ending their second cycle.  Their payments are very punctual just like they are.  Today they are very hard-working, active, and responsible women.

Olga is a very enterprising woman.  She says that she started a small drink store years ago.  Thanks to her effort and sacrifice her business has been able to grow.  This way she has become a complete small businesswoman.  Her goal is to keep working and growing.  She will do this so that she will be able to continue helping her family members.

She is requesting the loan to buy beer, wine, soft drinks, and other types of drinks.  This way she will be able to buy drinks and have these products in stock.

loans.use: to buy beer, wine, soft drinks, and other types of drinks.

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
El comité Sagrada Familia  se formó con la unión de 17 vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.  Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes,  pero también actividades como grupo, con lo que buscan fortalecerse como grupo.  Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de hacer todo tipo de labores juntas.
La Señora Luisa es una de las integrantes del comité, es casada y tiene un hijo. Ella se dedica  a la peluquería. Es peluquera a domicilio, es decir, ella se acerca hasta la casa de las clientas que la llaman para poder trabajar. De esa forma se ha hecho muy conocida y hoy en día ya tiene muy buena clientela. Su sueño es poder tener un local en su propia casa, para que no tenga que dejar mucho tiempo su casa.
Ella pide la ayuda de kiva y fundación paraguaya, para la compra de shampoo, gel, enjuagues, esmalte para uñas, peines, ruleros y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Sagrada Familia” (Sacred Family) communal bank was formed by the union of 17 neighbors from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.  All of the members carry on independent business activities.  They also have business activities as a group, which they do to strengthen themselves as a group.  The members formed a very united group that is capable of doing all types of work together.

Luisa is one of the members of the communal bank.  She is married and has one child.  She devotes herself to hairdressing.  She is a home hairdresser, which means that she goes to the customer’s house to be able to work when they call her.  She has become very well-known this way.  She now has a very good clientele.  Her dream is to be able to have a place in her own house.  That way she would not have to spend a lot of time away from her house.

She is asking Kiva and the Fundación Paraguaya for help to buy shampoo, gel, rinses, nail polish, combs, rollers, and other supplies to be able to keep working and meeting her customers’ demand.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, gel, rinses, nail polish, combs, rollers, and other supplies.

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es:
María, vive junto a su esposo y sus seis hijos en casa propia, ella junto a sus hijos se dedican a la siembra de granos básicos frijoles y maíz además en casa tiene crianza de cerdos, el oficio lo aprendieron de sus padres no tienen un horario establecido.
El préstamo lo necesitan para comprar concentrado para los cerdos y para insumos agrícolas como: herbicidas, semilla y abono, de esa forma obtendra lo necesario para la granja y la siembre, apoyandose de la familia al tener lo necesario para sus negocios.
El sueño de María  es siempre seguir trabajando y obtener mejores cosechas en este año y que su familia viva mejor.
texts.en: María lives with her husband and 6 children in her own home, and she and her family farm staple crops such as beans and corn.  They also care for pigs.  They learned these trades from their parents and work around the clock.  They seek this loan to buy feed for pigs and other agricultural items such as herbicide, seed and fertilizer.  In this way, they can increase production and cover the household's needs and expenses.  Maria dreams of working hard to obtain better crop harvests this year, to better provide for her family

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Rosa Poty Group

texts.es:
El comité Rosa Poty se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas y cría de animal. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. Se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto y desean poder seguir dentro del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya.
María es una de la integrantes y nos cuenta que tiene una carnicería, donde vende todo tipo de cortes de carnes, de primera y más económicas. Este trabajo es el que le ha dado la oportunidad de mantener su hogar y ayudar a su familia. Comenta que hoy en día es muy difícil mantener un negocio porque hay mucha competencia, pero que pese a ello no se desanima y sigue luchando.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cortes de carnes de todo tipo, con lo que podrá abastecer su negocio y poder cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Rosa Poty committee was formed by several neighbors in the city Santaní. All members maintain independent activities, such as sales or animal husbandry. The members have formed a very close-knit group capable of communal activities to benefit all of them. They are eager workers that wish to continue in the program of women entrepreneurs of the Paraguayan foundation.
María is one member who runs a butcher shop, selling all kinds of meat, from prime cuts to lesser quality cuts.  This job allows her to sustain her home and help her family.  She notes that growing competition makes it hard to maintain a business, but she continues working undiscouraged.
She seeks this loan to buy all kinds of cuts of meat to stock her butcher shop, to serve her customers.

loans.use: to buy cuts of meat for re-sale

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is thirty-nine years of age and is married with three children.

Vera owns and operates a business venture, selling fried foods in the local community.  She has three years of experience in this business.  Vera needs a loan of WST 2,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Vera joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks. This is Vera's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Rosal

texts.en:
Rosal is married and has five children. She is 48 years old and resides at Liposong, Ozamiz City, Philippines. 

Rosal owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting bananas for sale to earn a living. She has been in this business for ten years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. In 2007, Rosal joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. 

In the future, Rosal wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Medalla Milagrosa ” están  en el Séptimo Ciclo  con 18  integrantes , es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias  y responsables,  las mismas cuentan con actividades  diferentes, y realizan labores para la recaudación de fondos para el comité.
Celina se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, sea para hombres, mujeres y niños, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora. Nos comenta que desde siempre ha trabajado  y por ello no teme a los desafíos. Se define como una persona muy sacrificada y por sobre todo honesta, quien lucha por dar a su familia todo lo mejor día a día.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de todo tipo, como ser remeras, pantalones, camisas y demás, con lo que podrá estar bien surtida para sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Medalla Milagrosa ” committe is in its seventh cycle and has 18  members.  It is an outstanding and very close-knit group, known in the area for showing solidarity and for being responsible.  Members are engaged in various activities and work to collect funds for the committee.
Celina sells all kinds of clothing for men, women and children, and is a very hard-working woman. She says that she has always worked and does not fear adversity.  She considers herself honest .and self-sacrificing, and works hard to provide for her family's day to day needs.  She seeks this loan to buy a varied stock of clothing, such as shirts, pants, t-shirts and others, to provide a better variety of items for her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Tsoggerel

texts.en: Now he wants to make an adjustment to his car for routine maintenance. It will be good for his job performance. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to getting an adjustment to his car.

loans.use: To get an adjustment to his car.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is from Liposong, Ozamiz City. She is 33 years old. Sarah is married and has four children. To make a living, Sarah plants, harvests and sells bananas. Sarah has been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Sarah joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sarah is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pesticides and pay for banana planting. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and pay for banana planting.

loans.name: Lizet Margarita

texts.es:
Lizet es una joven de 23 años de edad, la cual vive en la ciudad de Mala, ubicada al sur de nuestra capital, se caracteriza por su clima cálido, así como también por su actividad principal que es la agricultura; Lizet está casada y junto a su esposo tienen 2 pequeños cuyas edades comprenden entre 1 y 5 años, el mayor ya va a la escuela y cursa el educación inicial, Lizet, su esposo trabaja en una universidad cuidando la plata de crianza de Tilapias. Lizet como buena peruana ama nuestra comida y su plato favorito es el “Chupe de camarones”; ella estudio hasta el quinto año de secundaria, debido a que sus padres no tenían los medios económicos suficientes , pero le hubiera gustado estudiar costura.

Lizet se dedica a la venta de abarrotes,dulces, helados y bebidas, ella trabaja desde muy temprano para ofrecer sus productos a sus clientes; trabaja alrededor de 12 horas y puede atender hasta 15 clientes al dia,, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque atiende de manera amable y sobre todo les brinda una sonrisa a sus clientes.

Lizet agradece mucho a los prestatarios Kiva ya que con la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá ampliar su negocio comprando , con esta mejora ella podra tener mas variedad de productos y con ello mejorar su calidad de vida y tendra mas ingresos para seguir ahorrando para poder cumplir su gran sueño:”Terminar de Construir su casa”.
texts.en:
Lizet is a 23-year-old young woman who lives in the city of Mala, located south of our capital. It is known for its warm climate and also, for its principal activity, agriculture.  Lizet is married and together with her husband, has 2 small ones whose ages are between 1 and 5 years of age. The older child already attends primary school. Lizet and her husband work in a local university caring for tilapia. Lizet,like a good Peruvian, loves our food and her favorite plate is “Chupe de camarones" (a local shrimp dish). She studied only up to the 5th year of secondary school, since her parents  lacked sufficient economic resources, but she would have liked to study dress-making. 

Lizet sells groceries, mainly sweets, ice cream, and drinks. She works from early morning, hoping to offer her products to customers. She works around 12 hours daily, and some 15 customers per day visit her shop. She believes her business is going well, because she runs her shop in a kindly manner and, above all, she offers her clients a smile. 

Lizet is grateful to the Kiva investors, since the help they have offered made it possible to expand her business by buying more merchandise. With this help, she was able to buy a greater variety of products and, thus, improve her quality of life, earning more income and saving more towards her grand dream: “to finish building her house.”

loans.use: buy merchandise, mainly groceries, for her store.

loans.name: Victor Michael

texts.en:
As quoted by Napoleon Hill, ” if you cannot do great things, do small things in a great way".  Mr. Victor Michael has the strong determination to achieve his desire. He is married, resides at Baybay Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental and is blessed with two children of school age.

Mr. Victor Michael is a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. He borrowed money in Paglaum MPC for the purpose of making a down payment om a motorcycle. 

Therefore, Mr. Victor Michael has the best way to predict the future: to create it.

loans.use: to pay the down payment for a motorcycle

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Leiua

texts.en:
Leiua is 48 years of age and married with eight children.

Leiua owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables to sell.  She has two years of experience in this business.    Leiua needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2011, Leiua joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Leiua's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is from Poblacion 2 Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 59 years old. Joel is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Joel raises livestock, primarily pigs, to sell. Joel has been engaged in his business for 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2004, Joel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. He is requesting a new loan of 42,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Seiloga

texts.en:
Seiloga is fifty-three years of age and is married with seven children.

Seiloga owns & operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has two years of experience in this business.    Seiloga needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Seiloga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Seiloga's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Oyunbayar

texts.en: Mrs. Oyunbayar, 32, works as a conductor of the public bus. She has been doing this job for many years and lives with her family in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband Bor runs a taxi around the districts of city and has had many permanent customers. The main income of this family consists of her or her husband’s business earnings. Lately, her husband’s taxi car has become bad and it's core parts are damaged. A month ago, his car's gear box broke and he still cannot not renew it. Due to this, his business has been stopped for over a month. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to purchasing the necessary spare-parts for his broken taxi car.

loans.use: To purchase spare-parts for her husband's broken taxi car.

loans.name: Pepe

texts.en:
Pepe is seventy-three years of age and is a widow with eight children.

Pepe owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has three years of experience in this business.    Pepe needs a loan of WST $2,000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Pepe joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Pepe's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy some new chairs and move to a new place that is nearer to her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his working capital so that he can earn more commisions

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is a 30 year old divorced mother of two. She runs her own store as a Champion Agent for Mobile Transactions in Solwezi providing money transfer services to her community. She started her business in July 2011 because she has always wanted to have a business of her own and when the opportunity came through Mobile Transactions, she took it. Within a month of starting her business Angela was already doing more than 1000 money transfers a month. 

Access to financial services in Zambia is both scarce and expensive. Close to 10 million Zambians, 80% of the population, do not have bank accounts. As most Zambians live in rural areas, distance and transportation factors hinder access to available financial services. Mobile Transactions Zambia Limited (MTZL) is an early stage company that specializes in low-cost mobile money and other financial transaction service by propagating an open network using small businesses called Champion Agents. Angela is a Champion Agent. This is her story. 

Angela believes her community benefits from her business in a very positive way because the service she provides is faster compared to other money transfer services and more often has enough cash to pay out receiving customers. She currently has one employee and two teller windows, which she uses to serve her customers. 

When Angela receives her loan she will be able to increase her float money (electronic and cash value of her working capital) which will enable her to satisfy more customers. She also wants to use the loan money to pay for her booth which she is currently using to serve her customers. Angela is hopeful that once she has increased her float money she will be able to earn more commissions and have enough money to have her children, who are currently living with her parents in Lusaka province 12 hours away, come live with her. 

In the video, a representative of MTZL interviews Angela.

loans.use: To pay for her booth and increase her electronic and cash working capital

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos de 54 años de edad es un hombre casado que vive en la ciudad de Cartagena y  tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 24 a 27 años. Es también el propietario de una tienda,  mediante la cual vende productos de primera necesidad al detalle, como ranchos, víveres enlatados, embutidos etc. negocio con el que ha logrado el sostenimiento de su familia. Su idea emprendedora empezó hace muchos años, cuando se dedicaba a la venta de frutas en un pequeño puesto en el mercado de la ciudad. Allí tuvo un accidente pues un burro le mordió la cara y como no podía continuar asoleándose, se ideó el vender productos de la canasta familiar, desde su propia casa a los vecinos; con este negocio le ha ido muy bien, pero sus expectativas de crecimiento, son superiores a su capital de trabajo por eso inyecta a su negocio, dinero de crédito y ha recibido de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo3 financiamientos; con esta organización tiene 4 años  de estar vinculado y  ha ido creciendo gradualmente; hoy está solicitando un credikiva, para comprar en mayor cantidad, víveres, licores y refrescos como cerveza, para surtir su negocio con mercancías, que son las que mas rotan en las épocas navideñas y de año nuevo. Esta es justamente su razón para aplicar un crédito a su negocio pues la probabilidad de éxito es alta y así mismo de su crecimiento como empresario de la microempresa.
texts.en: Carlos is 54 years old. He is married, he lives in the town of Cartagena and has 4 children aged between 24 and 27 years of age. He is a retailer and he also owns a shop where he sells basic necessities such as snacks, canned food, sausages and so on. Thanks to this activity he has succeeded in providing for his family. He came up with his entrepreneurial many years ago, while he was engaged in selling fruits in a small stall located in the town’s market and he suffered an accident: a donkey bit him in the face, and as he could not keep on working standing in the sun, he decided to sell basic necessities to his neighbors from his own house. This activity has been going very well but his expectations of growth are higher that his working capital can allow him: for this reason he invests money from the loans in his activity, having already received 3 loans from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He has been working for 4 years with this organization, gradually growing as well. He is now requesting a loan to buy large quantities of food, liquors and drinks such as beer to stock up his shop with the products he gets more requests for in the Christmas and New Year seasons. This is precisely his reason for asking for a loan for his shop, due to the high success rate of his activity, as well as those of growing as a micro entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy large quantities of food, liquors and drinks to stock up his shop.

loans.name: Paul Dario

texts.es: Paul de 22 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 1 a 7 años, allí tiene un negocio donde vende gafas y accesorios formulados y de lujo, estuches fantasías, artículos de plata y accesorios en oro golfi. Negocio que aprendió de su padre cuando al morir en el año 2001 , Paul se encargó del negocio que este dejó y en el año 2009 se ubicó en un corredor comercial importante del estadio de futbol profesional de Barranquilla, de donde fue reubicado e instalado en un local comercial, destinado para que vendedores ambulantes ocupen sin obstruir el espacio público.  Sus principales clientes son peatones, habitantes de la ciudadela del barrio, turistas, aficionados a los partidos de futbol, entre otros, a ellos les vende de contado aunque tiene también una cartera con créditos.  Su interés de crecimiento empresarial es evidente y es por esto que en la actualidad, está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará en mayor volumen que el acostumbrado, gafas y accesorios de lujo, estuches,  fantasías, artículos de plata y accesorios en oro golfi, para tener surtido su negocio en la época  de mayor disponibilidad de dinero que tienen sus clientes Navidad y fin de año y hacer de esta inversión todo un éxito..
texts.en:
Paul is 22 years old.  He lives with his common law wife and their 3 children ages 1 to 7.  

He has a business selling glasses, standard and luxury accessories, jewelry cases, silver and gold plated accessories. He learned this business from his father.  When his father died in 2001, Paul took over the business that his father left him.  In 2009 he moved to an busy commercial area near the professional soccer stadium in Barranquilla.  From there, he was relocated and moved to a shopping area set up for street merchants to use without obstructing public spaces.  His main customers are pedestrians, people who live in the neighborhood, tourists, soccer fans, etc.  He makes sales in cash although he can also take credit.  

His interest in growing his business is clear, and for this reason he is applying for a Kiva loan.  This is his first loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use it to purchase a greater than usual amount of glasses, luxury accessories, cases, costume jewelry, and silver and gold plated accessories so that his business is well stocked during Christmas and New Year’s, when his customers tend to have more money available. He plans to make this investment a success.

loans.use: to purchase larger than usual quantities of glasses, luxury accessories, cases, costume jewelry, silver and gold plated accessories.

loans.name: Santos Estela

texts.es:
Santos, vive con su esposo desde hace diez años junto con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de mariscos: pescado, conchas, curiles y camarón, el negocio lo inicio hace seis años con su esposo, no tiene un horario establecido.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar más marisco como: conchas,camarones y pescado, de esa manera tendrá una mejor oportunidad de vender más variedad y podrá darles lo que necesitan su familia.
El objetivo de Santos crecer en clientes y siempre mantener su negocio con variedad, obtener mejores ganancias cada día y poder darles siempre lo que necesitan su familia.
texts.en:
Santos has been living with her husband for 10 years. They have three children. She sells seafood: fish, scallops, shrimp. She started the business six years ago with her husband and does not have a set schedule.

Santos will use the loan to buy more seafood such as scallops, shrimp and fish. In this way she will have more opportunity to sell a greater variety of seafood and will be able to meet her family’s needs.

Santos’ goal is to expand her customer base and to always offer a range of seafood in her business so that she will earn more daily income and always be able to meet her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy fish, scallops and shrimp.

loans.name: Marcela Maribel

texts.es:
Marcela, se dedica a la venta de merienda, vive con su tía, la casa es familiar, ella está soltera no tiene hijos, desde hace un año está vendiendo meriendas y realiza las ventas en la casa.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de meriendas, como maíz, aceite, condimentos, azúcar, sal, carnes, pollo, para poder darle continuidad a la producción.
Con este préstamo espera tener el negocio estable, que le siga generando lo más necesario para su familia.
texts.en:
Marcela sells snacks. She lives with her aunt in the family home. She is single and does not have children. She has been selling snacks for a year and makes sales in the house.

Currently she is requeting a loan to purchase the basic material to make snacks such as corn, cooking oil, condiments, sugar, salt, beef and chicken so that she can continue production.

With this loan she hopes to provide stability to her business, which continues generating a needed income for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, cooking oil, condiments, sugar, salt, beef and chicken.

loans.name: Eunice Del Socorro

texts.es: Eunice  está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, pues está satisfecha con lo que obtuvo en su anterior financiamiento, mediante el cual compró mercancía variada, productos alimenticios y hasta calzado, todo esto lo vendió y aumentó su utilidad. En la actualidad, aprovechará la época de Diciembre, que es el mejor mes del año para vender la mercancía que ella ofrece y en esta temporada alta ella aumentará mucho mas sus ingresos, por eso comprara calzado que  tiene encargado por sus clientes y su compra la realizará en un mayor volumen con su nuevo credikiva. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Muchas gracias y Feliz Navidad y Próspero año nuevo, que sigan apoyando a los microempresarios como hasta ahora lo han hecho”.
texts.en: Eunice is requesting a new loan because she is very satisfied with what she has accomplished with her previous loan, thanks to which she has bought various products, food and even shoes: she has sold all these items thus increasing her profitability. She will now take advantage of the upcoming season as December is the best month of the year to sell the products she offers, and in this rich season she will sensibly increase her earnings. For this reason she will buy the shoes her customers have requested and she will purchase them in larger quantities thanks to her new loan. She sends the following message to Kiva lenders: “Thank you very much, Merry Christmas and Happy New Year. May you keep on supporting the micro entrepreneurs like you have done up to now”.

loans.use: To buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia y tambien vende leche en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la leche.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar leche y alimentos para los ganados.
 

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sabina continues to work in her livestock business, and she also sells milk in various markets in the Anta district.  She is able to provide for her children through this business.  Her dream is to have a store where she could sell milk.  Sabina requests a loan to buy milk and to buy feed for her livestock.

Sabina is happy to be getting this loan, and she pledges to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy milk, and to buy feed for her livestock

loans.name: Tsiyeregzen

texts.en:
Tsiyeregzen is 51 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a wooden house that is in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She sells various vegetables in the market. 

She requested a loan to purchase some necessary building materials to renovate her house because it has become too old and needs its flooring completely changed. Also, she will use her loan to increase her business capital for expanding her sales volume.

loans.use: To renovate her house.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Cusco y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Su actividad económica de Silvia es preparar cena para los choferes que brindan servicio de transporte en la ciudad del Cusco. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como carne,pollo,verduras y arroz al por mayor.


El banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Silvia is 40 years old, married, and has three children.  She was born in the city of Cusco and that is where she does business.  Silvia's business is making prepared dinners for the public transportation drivers of the city of Cusco.  Silvia currently needs this loan to buy supplies, such as bags of rice, bags of sugar, noodles, and other things.

The Nueva Esperanza Communal Bank is made up of responsible and hardworking people who get their families ahead.  The majority of its members live and work in the city of Cusco.  Cusco is known for being a big tourist attraction, for its business, for its traditional Inti Raymi celebration, and because it is the site of one of the seven wonder of the world, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to purchase meat, chicken, vegetables and rice at wholesale prices

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat and women's purses for resale.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Nelly, La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de compra y venta de verduras como zanahorias, lechuga, tomates entre otros, la socia vende las verduras a sus clientes que tiene en los mercados de Cusco y también lo envía a la ciudad  de Puerto Maldonado, la socia es una persona bien alegre y responsable, a la vez la socia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como gallinas y cuyes  siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más verduras para enviar a Puerto Maldonado y comprar alimento para sus animalitos como pasto y alfalfa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres En Acción" (Women in Action), located in the district of Anta belonging to the province of Anta and department of Cusco. The member is Ms. Nelly, who combines her daily activities with her business of buying and selling vegetables such as carrots, lettuce, and tomatoes among others.
